dataset.title: Data from one hectare monitoring site number 10, Mountain Zebra National Park

abstract.para:
These data were collected to intensively monitor habitat use by large herbivores in relation to vegetation in 1 hectare monitoring site in the Mountain Zebra National Park. The location of the site (called plot 10) shown in figure 7 of Novellie, P. 1989. Management plan of the Mountain Zebra National Park, unpublished, SANParks. the results are reported in:
1. Novellie, P. and Winkler, A. 1993. A simple index of habitat suitability for cape mountain zebras. Koedoe 36(2): 53-59. 2. Novellie, PA. 1990. Habitat use by indigenous in relatio to sward structure and veld condition. journal of the grassland society of southern africa. 7: 16-23. 3. Novellie, PA. 1991. Seasonal movements and habitate use by African grazing ungulates in a small conservation area. Pp. 709-713 in proceedings of the IVth international rangeland congress Vol. 2. Associetion francaise de pastoralism montopellier, france.
The survey was conducted in April-May 1987. Follow-up surveys could indicate vegetation changes that have occurred since then.

keywordSet.keyword: vegetation monitoring, herbivory, plant species composition, habitat use.
Mountain Zebra National Park, South Africa

intellectualRights.para: SANParks should be ucknoleged for the data capture and the use. digital and non-digital data and metadata belongings to the SANParks care provided on an ''as-is'' basis with no gurantee as to data quility. Nether the staff nor South African National Parks (SANParks) may held liable for any loss of any sort resulting from use of data and/metadata provided by SANParks.

section.para: The method use to survey the vegetation was the descending point survey for canopy spread cover. eight plot were located ta randomly within the 1ha area monitoring site.two hundred point were examine d in each plot, the points being arranged in eight rows of 25 each, with 1m specieng between points and rows. the higher of grasses encounterd was measured from the ground to the tallest leaf. the canopy spread cover of all plant species in the plots are presented, as well as the cover of grass in three diferant height classes. the veld condition index was calculated (from Vorster.M. 1982. The development of the ecological index method from asessing veld condition in the Karoo. Proceeding of the grassland society of south Africa 17:84-8)

The extent of grazing of plant was awarded a score according to the percentage of leaves (in the case of grass) and shoot ends (in the case of woody plant and forb) that had been severed. scoring was as follows:
The use of the monitoring site by large herbivores was determined by counting the number of dunh group within eight randomly located plots, each 200 square meters in area.

project.title: Therole of herbivory in maintaining habitat heterogeneityin the mountain zebra national park
